Case reference: 2006019799.CaseDesc: Anthony Evans was last seen on Jarvis Lake on June 12, 1984.  He fell from the boat he was in and his body has not been recovered.

Boots: Leather, Brown, Steel toe work boots

Case reference: 2014004487.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2003, at approximately 9:00 a.m. a fisherman and his helper, Phillip McKay, left Berens River Manitoba to retrieve their commercial fishing nets from Sandy Bar Bay. Upon arrival, one of the nets got caught in the propeller of the boat motor, pulling the boat down. Shortly thereafter, 2 large waves capsized the boat and both men were thrown into the water. Both men were wearing oilers, making it difficult to swim. The fisherman survived and was treated for shock and hypothermia. The body of his helper, Phillip McKay was never located.  Phillip McKay is presumed dead due to drowning.

Deformity: Right Leg, Crooked, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2020006296.CaseDesc: On October 16, 1964, Carol Turner was last seen with two boys from the Black Diamond Riders Motorcycle Club in Toronto, Ontario. Earlier that evening, Carol had argued with her mother, and left the house after her mother had gone to sleep.

Case reference: 2014005794.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2012 at 11 p.m., Pierre Desjardins left his residence in Notre-Dame-de-Lourdes, Quebec on foot and has not been seen since. Pierre was known to live a transient lifestyle and had made suicidal comments in the past.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Castle with a dragon on the bicep

Case reference: 2015017939.CaseDesc: On November 10, 1998, the body of a man was discovered in a container shipped by the "Cast" Company, which was being stored in the Port of Montreal. The individual had taken refuge, with food, in the shipping container which had arrived in Montreal by boat (the "Canmar Valour") from Livorno, Italy.

Shoes: Brown, "Vera Gomma Italie" brand shoes, with laces. Inscribed "TAOS"
Belt: Dark patterned belt with a silver coloured buckle
Socks: Grey, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, With holes
White, Blue, With dark blue and light blue lines.
Leggings: Cotton, Black, White, Adidas boxers with white lignes.

Case reference: 2014005326.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1972, Edmonton Police Service members found a purse and identification belonging to Eunice Antoniuk on the walkway of the High Level Bridge in Edmonton, Alberta. A note addressed to her family was found within the purse. All police searches were negative and Eunice has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2012020019.CaseDesc: Emerson Dobroskay, was last seen on October 28, 1988 at the Pit Pub located at the University of British Columbia. It is believed that Emerson may have fallen into a large pit dug for construction, but all searches have failed to locate him. Although foul play is not suspected, it cannot be ruled out.

Case reference: 2014006318.CaseDesc: On November 18, 2013, it is believed that Stewart Ward travelled from Brampton to Niagara Falls, Ontario.  Stewart's vehicle was later located in a parking lot near the Falls.  Stewart has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2008245047.CaseDesc: Jadon may be in the company of his non-custodial mother Roxana Eliana YANEZ PARADA.

Case reference: 2014003573.CaseDesc: On October 11, 1978, George Greyeyes left from Petersfield, Manitoba on a hunting trip. He left by canoe and was supposed to return that same day. Water conditions were poor with high winds and waves. On October 12, 1978, he had not yet returned and was reported missing to police. Searches were conducted and he was never located. Mr. Greyeyes is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014002222.CaseDesc: On September 9, 1958, at approximately 9:15 a.m., Cindy-Lou McLane was last seen playing outside of her residence in Willow River, British Columbia. There is a strong possibility that Cindy-Lou may have been abducted.

Case reference: 2006012899.CaseDesc: Delmar Henderson was last seen in the area of Burnt River (Kinmount), Ontario on June 2, 1983.

Case reference: 2014004779.CaseDesc: On May 3, 2006, Mr. David Robillard left a cultural camp with the intention to walk back to his home community of Black Lake, SK. He was not seen again.

Deformity: Right Leg, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2018020521.CaseDesc: On April 3, 2018, Shaun “Sandy” Mullen was last seen leaving the West Parry Sound Health Centre in Parry Sound, Ontario. Police have reason to believe that Shaun accessed a taxi and returned to his Parry Sound residence prior to his disappearance shortly thereafter. Shaun has past tendencies to visit friends or go camping for extended periods of time but there is no indication this is the case.

Case reference: 2011000299.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2010, the skeletal remains of a Caucasian male were found in the forest near Chemin Lac Clair in West Nipissing, Ontario. He is believed to have been there from two weeks to six months.

Hair: Brown, Short, Shorter than collar length
Teeth: Some dental work and some untreated dental disease
Other: Signs of arthritis in his feet. Bandages on them suggesting that he may have experienced pain

Case reference: 2013000025.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1998, Darwin Sylvester was seen for the last time at approximately 23:00 hrs. He called his girlfriend shortly after midnight on May 29th. Mr. Sylvester had plans to meet with an associate for breakfast, however he never showed for the meeting. His belongings and luggage were all located at the residence on Chalmers. He has not had any contact with friends or family since.

Tattoo: Left Arm, "Spartans MC in Memory of" (text)

Case reference: 2006009799.CaseDesc: On May 25, 1974, Francis Foster, Robert Warren and another friend departed for a canoe trip on Basswood Lake, Quetico Park, 45 miles (72 km) south of Atikokan, Ontario. It is believed that the canoe overturned and all three are presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2012020647.CaseDesc:
Ricky Riopel was reported missing in August 2010 by family members who had not seen or heard from him since December 2008. It was later established that Mr. Riopel had been in Moose Jaw at a health care facility in October 2009.   
Investigators now believe the last confirmed sighting of Mr. Riopel was in Saskatoon, at a downtown shopping mall, in September 2010. Mr. Riopel's parents are both failing in health which has prompted this additional request for public assistance.

Case reference: 2016066831.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1971, an autopsy was performed on the unidentified remains of a male. The exact location where the deceased was found is unknown at this point, but is in the Windsor area. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 150lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was uncircumsized. He is believed to have been dead for a few days to a few weeks.

Teeth: Four front upper incisors had been filled with gold amalgam.

Case reference: 2019062090.CaseDesc: On October 26, 2019, Maysa Nouasri was last seen with her father, Larbi Nouasri, in the borough of Saint-Léonard in Montreal, Quebec. It is believed that the two have travelled to Algeria, without Maysa’s mother’s consent.

Case reference: 2014002218.CaseDesc: On September 18, 1977, Arthur Roy was seen for the last time, at approximately 1400hrs, when he left his home on foot in North Bay, Ontario. Mr. Roy was suffering from a mental illness and was believed to be senile due to old age.

Case reference: 2014005441.CaseDesc: On April 23, 2010, Roland Enabulele was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roland had taken a trip to Spain and has last spoken with his ex-wife on May 3. During that conversation, Roland advised her that he would be returning to Toronto on May 5, but never returned.

Case reference: 2014003015.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1984 Donald Williamson's brother reported him as missing since September 6th. He has a history of disappearing without maintaining contact with his family. There is no foul play suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2014004617.CaseDesc: Richard Deren was last seen in Vancouver on March 12, 2005. He disappeared and neither his family nor friends had heard from him. This was unusual behaviour for him not to keep in contact with his friends.

Case reference: 2014022293.CaseDesc: In February 1981, Emery LABOUCANE left his residence and went to work. While at work, he called his wife and stated he was on his way home. He never returned. His vehicle was later located at the Edmonton International Airport. LABOUCANE's credit cards were used in California over the course of the following month and then the usage ceased. No further activity was ever recorded on the credit cards.

Case reference: 2014005513.CaseDesc: Jayson Nakas was reported missing on June 30, 1995 to the RCMP in Drayton Valley, Alberta. Mr. Nakas fell off an inner tube on the North Saskatchewan River. Mr. Nakas' friends saw him go under water but did not see him come back up.  His friends were the last ones to see him that day.

Case reference: 2006010099.CaseDesc: David Stevens was last seen June 14, 1979, in a canoe on the Ogoki River, approximately 70 km north of Armstrong. He was believed to be going towards Whitewater Lake. An extensive search failed to locate Mr. Stevens.

Case reference: 2014004988.CaseDesc: Margaret Blackbird was last seen in Loon Lake, Saskatchewan in 1951. It had been suspected that Ms. Blackbird left for either Alberta or British Columbia; however, she made no further contact with her family. Inquiries to locate Ms. Blackbird in Alberta and British Columbia have been unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2020009327.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2020, James Garnett was seen for the last time at approximately 9:25 pm when he was exiting a bus onto Douglas Avenue near the Reversing Falls Bridge located in Saint John, New Brunswick.

Hat: Blue, White, Toque, Has white snowflakes

Case reference: 2013000010.CaseDesc: On December 3rd 1996, family members of Jaime Wyatt made a report to the St-John's RCMP that he had not been seen since November 12th, 1996. Mr. Wyatt, a resident of Newfoundland, left the province in September 1996 to seek employment in Nova Scotia. The investigation revealed that Jaime Wyatt had been staying at the Twin Elms Motel on Inglis Street in Halifax and he was last seen there on November 16th, 1996. His motel room was paid in full until the 17th of November 1996. On the evening of November 16th, 1996, Mr. Wyatt informed the staff at the Twin Elms that someone was going to be picking him up to go out to a dinner party and other functions that evening. Mr. Wyatt was never heard from or seen since that day. Foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2020015197.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Tony Noskey was seen for the last time as he was riding a four-wheel all-terrain vehicle with his friends near the community of Cadotte Lake in Alberta. During the course of this outing, Tony had disappeared into the bush, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2015059337.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2015, at approximately 10:30 p.m., Van Huong was last seen on vacation in Vietnam. The next morning, Van’s family noticed he had left the hotel room and had not returned.

Case reference: 2019040401.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1975, this approximately 60 year old man collapsed on East Hastings Street in Burnaby, British-Columbia. He had a bruise on the left side of his head and had recently undergone cranial surgery due to a head injury.

Case reference: 2016069130.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1969, the remains of a male were recovered from the Mattagami River, north of the bridge which crosses between Timmins and Mountjoy township. His post-mortem length was 5'6" to 5'7" and his weight at autopsy was recorded at 145 lbs., however these measurements may not be an accurate reflection of his living height and weight.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were absent with the exception of three anterior teeth.

Case reference: 2012020654.CaseDesc: On May 12, 1997, Darold Kishayinew was last seen at a relative’s house in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014002017.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1997, Marc Dionne was seen for the last time as he was leaving the Harley Pub in the Cap-de-la-Madeleine area of Trois-Rivières, Quebec. He was a passenger in a small white vehicle. Marc was reported missing on the next day and there has been no news from him since.

Case reference: 2006009599.CaseDesc: Elizabeth Ann Kant has been missing since October 16, 1972. She had been with a hunting party in Adair Township, approximately 73 miles east of Cochrane and was last seen about 2.4 miles south of Camp # 23, Abitibi limits.

Jewelry: Gold, White, Yellow, ring; wedding band
Jacket: Black, Red, men's plaid hunting jacket
Pants: Green, Ski slacks with elastic strap under the feet
Scar: Right Foot, from bone spur surgery

Case reference: 2014003140.CaseDesc: Anthony Philip Porter was last seen on June 26, 1969 while he was picking up groceries near his home in the city of Kimberley, British Columbia. He never returned. Anthony is developmentally delayed.

Scar: Right Calf, Two inch scar on right shin
Head, Half inch scar over the right ear

Case reference: 2006005799.CaseDesc: On September 26, 1993, the right foot of an adult, washed ashore on the south side of Pelee Island, which is in Lake Erie, Ontario. The foot was contained in a white cotton sock and an LA Gear running shoe, size 8. A search of the area failed to locate any other remains. There is limited information available on this case.

Shoes: High top running shoe, "L.A. Gear" brand, size 8

Case reference: 2005007499.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1985, an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 50-60 years, was recovered from the Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist boarding dock. His post-mortem weight was recorded as 127.5lbs. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'3''-5'4''; however, due to traumatic injury this may not accurately represent his actual living height. He was recovered without clothing or personal effects. It is not known how long he had been in the water. A man, similarly described, was seen jumping over the Niagara Falls 5 days prior to the date that this unidentified man was recovered.

Hair: Grey, White, It is unknown whether he had any scalp hair but a few white hairs were noted on the back of his neck
Teeth: Several of his teeth were missing prior to his death and he has some fillings. He also has a cast chrome partial upper denture.
Mark: Left Side Of Head, Raised "age spots" on his head, left cheek and behind his left ear.
Deformity: Upper Left Back, A papilloma (benign non-cancerous tumor) over his left shoulder blade
Scar: Right Pelvis, 2cm right inguinal (groin area) scar

Case reference: 2018040962.CaseDesc: Ryan Duncan was last seen on July 17, 2018, at a motel in Lumby, British Columbia, while travelling in the area. Ryan's vehicle was located in Vernon, British Columbia on July 21, 2018.

Case reference: 2008004299.CaseDesc: Ghazaros Allahverdioglu was boating with family on Fairy Lake in the town of Huntsville, Ontario.  He apparently fell off the boat by One Tree Island in Fairy Lake.

Case reference: 2014004516.CaseDesc: On March 19 2004, Daniel James Murray was reported missing to the RCMP in Drayton Valley, Alberta. Daniel slipped on ice and fell into the North Saskatchewan River in the area of Drayton Valley, Alberta. Daniel has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002240.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1993, Marcus Laing was reported missing when he failed to show up for work which was out of character for him.

Case reference: 2013000036.CaseDesc: Pierre Roy was last seen on January 28, 1983.  He was involved in an altercation in a bar in Montreal and has not been seen since.

Teeth: Braces, Wears 2 dentures, the top one is welded
Scar: Right Leg, 2 scars on each side of 5" long

Case reference: 2013000128.CaseDesc: On June 13, 1990, Delphine Nikal was left in the care of her uncle. At approximately 2:00 pm Delphine advised her uncle she was going to meet her three girlfriends in Smithers BC (approx 16 km. away).  Delphine hitchhiked to Smithers and met up with her friends. At approximately 10:00 pm Delphine called her uncle to tell him that she was on her way home from Smithers. She was last seen by her two friends hitchhiking in the east bound lane of Hwy #16.

Jacket: Denim, Blue, Light bleached with white pocket sewn on inside, Levi's
Purse: Leather, Black, Pouch style containing hair spray, brush, pictures, make up, address book
Pants: Denim, Pink, Described as a hot pink and tight to the leg. Knee length

Case reference: 2014001482.CaseDesc: Ghislain Latour was last seen on December 9, 1982 at the Evain hotel in Evain village, which is now part of Rouyn-Noranda in the province of Quebec.

Case reference: 2014006454.CaseDesc: Jonathan Jay Wood was last seen in November 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2013000124.CaseDesc: Maxwell Brown is from Bella Bella and traveled to Klemtu to look for work in late April 2012.  He was last seen in Klemtu on May 1, 2012.

Hat: Black, BASEBALL, Baseball cap with "C" on front
Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, "REST IN PEACE"

Case reference: 2017014435.CaseDesc: On May 21, 2009, an unidentified man died of lung cancer in the Foothills Hospital in Calgary, Alberta. It was later discovered that this individual had presented false identification at the hospital and was buried under the same incorrect name. At the time of his death this man had a black mustache. There were no teeth present and this individual had upper and lower dentures.

Jewelry: Metal, White, EARRING, White metal with a clear stone
Tattoo: Right Hip, Naked woman intertwined with dragon down thigh

Case reference: 2012020086.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1993, Willard Brass, 52 years old, was last seen at a residence in Yorkton, SK. He was reported missing on May 27, 1993, by his family. Searches and investigation have failed to locate him.

Hat: Black, Red, ball cap, crest of sunsets, with horse and rider, "Black Hills South Dakota" in writing
Tattoo: Left Hand, love (text) and 4 aces across the fingers
Right Forearm, dagger and a heart
Left Forearm, born to be wild 1962 (text)

Case reference: 2014005728.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2011, James Mayer was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. James had last spoken with his mother on December 14.

Case reference: 2014002474.CaseDesc: Kenley Matheson was a student at Acadia University, Wolfville, Nova Scotia in September 1992. On September 21st it was reported that he was seen by a friend walking on Main Street in Wolfville, N.S. This was the last time anyone has seen or heard from Kenley Matheson.

Jewelry: Gold, Necklace - gold eagle pendant, 1 IN
Metal, White, Watch - White Face Seiko, 8M2571000, SN 040792
Gold, Earring worn in left ear
Coat: Nylon, Blue, Helly Hansen, mountain coat

Case reference: 2015011649.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1999, a black man died in a fatal road accident in Montreal in the Ahuntsic district. This person would have been approximately 25 years old.

Pants: Blue, White, "Puma" written on the left thigh
Coat: Blue, White, plaid with a gray hood

Case reference: 2013000110.CaseDesc: Robert Gorassi is a full time resident in Toronto and was on an outing at Kinark Outdoor Centre where he was last seen at 4:30 p.m on October 25, 2012.

Hair: Black, White, Short, Grizzled beard, moustache & sideburns

Case reference: 2014006224.CaseDesc: In January 2013, Da Wang was seen for the last time by his fiancé in Buffalo, New York. However, the two continued to communicate through text messages for several months. On July 11, 2013, at approximately 7:18 p.m., Da’s fiancé received a final text message from him indicating that he was in trouble.

Case reference: 2012020047.CaseDesc: Joseph Thomas Zerk was last seen on December 1, 2008 in Edmonton. He was facing some medical issues, and was sometimes homeless.

Case reference: 2005005299.CaseDesc:
On January 2, 1995, the partial skeletal remains of an unidentified man were found in front of a children's playground adjacent to Lake Ontario near Navy and Front Streets in Oakville. 
The time since death is estimated to be months to several years.

Case reference: 2006026799.CaseDesc: On Friday, May 19, 1967, at about 06:10 A.M,. Victor Morris left his cottage on the South Shore of Lake Nipissing in an 18 foot Geisler Cedar Strip boat with an 18 hp motor. On Sunday, May 21 1967, the boat was recovered on Manitou Island in Lake Nipissing. The boat was partially burnt and the motor showed signs of having exploded.

Case reference: 2006017999.CaseDesc: Agnes Battersby was visiting a friend in Barrie, Ontario; who then drove her home around 1:30 a.m. on July 28, 1968. She was unable to walk very far due to her disability. She has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2018043194.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1990, Laura Hamilton was last seen by her fiancé leaving a restaurant in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001814.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1973, between 2:00pm and 5:00pm Steve Mysick packed a suitcase and left the residence where he was staying, located in Rapid City, Manitoba. Steve Mysick was an outpatient of the Brandon Mental Hospital and had been staying with his friends for 2.5 years at the time of his disappearance.   Mr. Mysick was last seen at the CP train station in Brandon, Manitoba. It is likely Mr. Mysick purchased the ticket to Winnipeg as he had very limited funds available and had lived in Winnipeg in the past. There is no indication if Mr. Mysick actually boarded the train to Winnipeg.   Steve Mysick has never been located and his whereabouts is unknown. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014001102.CaseDesc: On March 4, 1973, the remains of a young adult man were recovered from the Burrard Inlet in Vancouver, British Columbia. He carried a Canada flag pocket knife and is believed to have been in the water for several months prior to the discovery.

Case reference: 2015011673.CaseDesc: On July 26, 1992, a man fell to his death fifty feet from Complexe Desjardins in Montreal. The man would possibly be Asian.

Case reference: 2014003816.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1992, Stéphane Murray left his residence in the Beauport area to attend an appointment. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Arm, Death's head and a bat

Case reference: 2014006333.CaseDesc: Deanne MacNeil was last seen on video surveillance at the Mundare Liquor Store during the early morning hours of November 28, 2013.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2014004736.CaseDesc: Mary-Anne Loranger, her husband and their baby were camping on Beckwith Island in Georgian Bay for an unknown amount of time, prior to July 31, 1970. In the morning of August 2, 1970, Mary-Anne Loranger left Beckwith Island with a male friend, Robert Lehto in a canoe. Their intended destination was Cedar Point, Tiny Township, Ontario. A storm occurred later that day and did not subside until August 4, 1970. It is believed the canoe they were in capsized at some point while they were on their way to Cedar Point.

Case reference: 2014002743.CaseDesc: On January 16, 1994, Yoann Crouzatier was reported missing after leaving the family residence in Laval, Quebec. Yoann has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Beige, Three-quarters with fur trimmed hood
Boots: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Metal tips

Case reference: 2014003554.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1986, Edward Ludwig left his work site at Bow Valley Provincial Park, AB, to go boating on Lake Minnewanka in Banff National Park, AB.  Mr. Ludwig was despondent when he left.  His vehicle was located at Lake Minnewanka, AB and an unoccupied boat was found floating on the lake.

Case reference: 2014002684.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1994, Mathieu Landry was reported missing by a traveling companion. Mr. Landry was renting a cabin at Juara village on Tioman Island in Malaysia when he went for a walk and never returned. Sunglasses belonging to Landry where found on the beach. His passport, clothing, backpack and other personal effects where recovered from the resort where he was staying. Land and water searches involving police divers where done and failed to locate him; he was presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2019009625.CaseDesc: On August 12, 2018, Nikhil Arun was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002857.CaseDesc: Colin Campbell was last seen March 12, 1998. Mr.Campbell was seen jumping off the Reversing Falls Bridge in Saint John, NB. His body has not been recovered.

Case reference: 2012020072.CaseDesc: Claudette Osborne (nee Tyo) was last seen on the morning of July 25, 2008  walking away from the Lincoln Motor Inn on McPhillips Street.

Hair: Brown, Blonde, Straight, Long, bottom 12" dyed blonde

Case reference: 2014001852.CaseDesc: Ms. RUNNINGBIRD was out near Swan Lake.  She walked away from her friends and never returned.

Case reference: 2014002875.CaseDesc: Edmond Belliveau was last seen on Oct 1, 1985, in Saint John, NB.

Case reference: 2022002122.CaseDesc: On January 3, 2022, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Karl Neff was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Port Colborne, Ontario. Karl has ties to the St. Catharines area in Ontario.

Case reference: 2005006299.CaseDesc:
On June 16 1977, the body of a male was recovered from the Niagara River at the Canadian Niagara Power House above the Niagara Falls. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 200-210 lbs and his length was measured at 5'8", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His appendix is present and he may have suffered from high blood pressure, diabetes and/or alcoholism. He may have also suffered from pancreatitis in the past. He is thought to have been in the water for approximately 1 to 2 months.

Teeth: Partial acrylic denture:upper incisors and some premolars. Lost all lower molars and lower right 2nd premolar prior to death.
Shirt: Plaid shirt, blue and cream coloured

Case reference: 2021056970.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1998, the remains of an unidentified woman were recovered from North West Connoire in Newfoundland. The woman had a complete fusion of the proximal and intermediate phalanges of her right ring finger. This fusion would have rendered her joint completely immobilized.

Case reference: 2011000198.CaseDesc: On Wednesday, November 9, 2011 at approximately 11:15 a.m., Gordon Gibbs walked away from the Greater Niagara General Hospital, where he was a patient. About 30 minutes later a witness saw a man matching Mr. Gibbs's description looking over the railing into the hydro feeder canal in the area of Portage Rd. and Morrison St., Niagara Falls. Mr. Gibbs suffers from mental health issues and dementia.

Hair: White, Short, Receding hair;white beard, moustache and sideburns

Case reference: 2006013299.CaseDesc: Thomas Hesse was last seen on September 2, 1989 in Moonbeam Township, near Cochrane, Ontario.  He was riding a Raleigh, 3-speed, gold coloured, lady's bicycle.  Mr. Hesse left his parents' house in a depressed state and may have been suicidal.

Case reference: 2014003868.CaseDesc: On Sunday, April 18, 1976, at approximately 12:00 pm, Gary Michael Pinkney departed his residence in Fort Churchill, Manitoba on his snowmobile. He was destined for the Hudson Bay and had planned to return home that same evening. On April 19, 1976, at approximately 8:00 am, Helen Pinkney contacted the Churchill RCMP Detachment and reported that her husband had not yet returned home. Extensive searches were done of the area by land and by air for several days with negative results.   The remains of Mr. Pinkney have not been located and given his intended route, it is presumed that he drowned.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with black stone
Scar: 4 inch scar on either left or right leg
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Eagle with rising sun

Case reference: 2014005786.CaseDesc: Giuseppe Renda was last seen on May 4, 2012, at approximately 12:30 p.m., on Saint-Viateur Street West in the Plateau Mont-Royal borough of Montreal, Quebec. Giuseppe lived in the Westmount District, and was a discreet man who did not leave his home often.

Case reference: 2005004299.CaseDesc: On April 10, 1998, the partial skeletal remains of an unidentified man were recovered from the Niagara River bay area at the rear of the Sir Adam Beck Power Station, near the turbine intakes. He is believed to have been in the water for many months to many years.

Case reference: 2014001312.CaseDesc: John McAllister was last seen leaving his home on May 7, 1973. Mr. McAllister's truck was found near Lodgepole, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004086.CaseDesc: On July 13,1981, Sophia Armstrong was seen for the last time. Her companion reported that she had gone on a trip, which was out of character for Ms. Armstrong.

Case reference: 2015006607.CaseDesc: Peter Russell Yellowbird was reported missing by his family after they became concerned that he had been out of contact for so long. It is believed that Mr. Yellowbird’s last known location was in the Downtown area of Edmonton. Mr. Yellowbird’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being. There are no indications to suggest foul play.

Case reference: 2014004498.CaseDesc: Guillermina Coleman left her residence in the Cypress View Foundation between 8:00 p.m. on July 4, and 10:00 a.m. on July 5, 2004. Mrs. Coleman was despondent, and was released from the hospital only a few days before she was last seen. Mrs. Coleman was only able to walk for short distances.

Case reference: 2015017928.CaseDesc: On December 17, 2000, this man was found under the Angrignon and Notre-Dame viaduct in Montreal. He was an itinerant who often slept there.

Case reference: 2010002599.CaseDesc: On the morning of Monday, July 19, 2010, Curtis Barry left his residence on Britannia Avenue in Bradford, to walk his two dogs. He was reported missing when his wife returned home in the late afternoon and discovered he was not home. The dogs were located later the same day wandering the streets approximately 1 km from his residence. Mr. Barry has not been seen since and the dog leash has not been located.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, a ship and names Lauren, John and Cliff on boat
Torso (Back), 3 roses with names of Michelle, Kietan and Kayla

Case reference: 2018070577.CaseDesc: On January 15, 2018, at approximately 6:00pm, Albert Ramponi was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002991.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1988, Roberta Ferguson and eight other youths went to Sunnyside Campground at Cultus Lake in Chilliwack, BC. On August 24, 1988, Ms. Ferguson left the group on foot, it is believed she intended to return to her home in Surrey, British Columbia. Witnesses reported having seen a female walking on Columbia Valley Road, and others reported having seen a female getting into a vehicle at the intersection of Vedder Road and Cultus Lake Road. Ms. Ferguson has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014000018.CaseDesc: Dawn Rees was last seen in Calgary on March 10, 2001. Ms. Rees was known to lead a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014004404.CaseDesc: On September 12, 1993, Sidiki Camara was reported missing by air traffic control after disappearing from the radar while flying to Prince Edward Island from the Moncton Airport. Sidiki's plane was last recorded descending at a high rate of speed. Only a few parts of the plane were found during a search of the crash location.

Case reference: 2011003099.CaseDesc: Brian Dunlop was dropped off in the downtown area of North Bay, Ontario by his father on the morning of June 2, 1994.  His family has not been in contact with him since that time.  In August of 1994, Brian was seen in North Bay and Oshawa, Ontario by people who knew him. This is the last time he was seen by anyone.

Case reference: 2016017728.CaseDesc: Reid Chesney left a men's shelter in Halifax, Nova Scotia on April 4, 2016. Mr. Chesney lived a transient lifestyle and had very little communication with family members. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004699.CaseDesc: On October 4, 2005, Veeravi Jeya Eskimuttu "VJ", was last seen leaving his place of employment in Saint John, NB. He is known to be transient and has lived in Toronto, Cornwall, Montreal and Halifax.

Case reference: 2006007899.CaseDesc: Edward Michael Krantz was last seen on August 23, 1975. He paddled alone into Lake Huron to go fishing, in a 17 foot aluminium MICHI Craft canoe, serial MCC11799M74JF7. Mr. Krantz and the canoe have never been located.

Socks: White, Knee high, yellow top stripe
Pants: Orange, Red, white and blue striped pants
Scar: Lower Back, 25 inch vertical scar from surgery

Case reference: 2014005222.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2008, at approximately noon, Syed Zaman was seen for the last time at his home in Toronto, Ontario.
